basics.name: Qi Zhang
basics.label: M.S. Student
basics.summary: A female programmer passionate about research, aiming to leverage technology to better benefit the world.

work.name: Shanghai Bilibili Technology Co., Ltd.
work.summary: Engaged in academic research related to OCR, NLP and large language modeling (LLM), and responsible for the daily maintenance and research and development of the company's core products for video comprehension and content security.

work.name: Wuxi Zhongke Suhui Automation Technology Co., Ltd.
work.summary: Developed an automated road environment analysis system for autonomous driving, using image processing techniques for precise detection and recognition of key road targets and lane information.

volunteer.summary: Participated in a program that sent selected students to economically and educationally disadvantaged areas, where we learned about local customs and living conditions, and conveyed our care and advanced ideas.
highlights: Awarded as an Outstanding Summer Social Practice Team at the University Level in 2019.

awards.title: Academic Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded a scholarship covering tuition fees and living expenses supporting post-graduate studies in the field of Computer Science.

awards.title: NARI First-Class Scholarship
awards.awarder: Sponsored by NARI Technology Co., Ltd.

publications.name: CRMSP: A Semi-supervised Approach for Key Information Extraction with Class-Rebalancing and Merged Semantic Pseudo-Labeling
publications.summary: To address the long-tail problem in extracting information from a large amount of unlabeled text, a semi-supervised method called CRMSP is proposed, which significantly reduces labeling costs and improves the model's generalization ability. 1) The CRP module aims to solve the issue of underestimated confidence for tail classes in long-tail distributions. 2) The MSP module addresses the difficulty of achieving intra-class compactness and inter-class separability for tail classes in the unlabeled feature space.

publications.name: Balanced-to-unbalanced filtering magic-T based on circular patch resonator with high selectivity
publications.summary: This Letter presents a new design of balanced-to-unbalanced (B2U) filtering magic-T based on circular patch resonator. By studying the electric field distributions of the degenerate resonant modes, the in-phase and out-of-phase specifications are achieved without additional circuits.

references.name: Professor Yonghong Song
references.reference: Zhang Qi’s technical expertise, innovative thinking, and collaborative spirit have greatly contributed to our research efforts. I am confident that Zhang Qi will bring the same excellence to any future endeavors and will be a valuable asset to any team or organization.

references.name: Professor Nicola Clayton
references.reference: Zhang Qi’s enthusiasm and curiosity on the subject throughout the programme have been exemplary. Zhang Qi’s engagement with other students of the programme and the leading expert in the field were also impressive. In the end, Zhang Qi and several other students presented a well-structured group presentation on the independent research they had done in the programme.

projects.name: Web-Based Intelligent Document Information Extraction System
projects.summary: Developed a system to extract key information from complex documents, focusing on named entity recognition and entity relationship extraction.
highlights: Utilized multimodal Transformer models such as LayoutLMv3, LiLT, and ERNIE to process documents containing rich text, layout, and visual information, reducing required parameters and overall computational load, and improving model efficiency.
Fine-tuned pre-trained models on integrated public datasets or user-uploaded private datasets from various domains such as legal, financial, and medical.

projects.name: Knowledge Graph-Based Visual Question Answering System
projects.summary: Developed a visual question-answering system based on knowledge graphs, addressing multimodal information tasks.
highlights: Used ZS-VQA structure as the baseline and conducted ablation experiments on different modules. By training different feature mapping spaces (semantic space for relations, object space for supporting entities, and knowledge space for answers), the system more accurately aligned image-question pairs with answers, enhancing question-answering accuracy.
